Uses of Package
functions

  • Packages that use functions 
    Package Description
    application
    this package contains the code for the GUI, which uses the other two packages
    functions
    This package contains all classes nessecary, to work with mathematical functions, with the most important class being Function
    stringConverter
    This package contains all the stuff needed to convert a String to a Function
  • Classes in functions used by application 
    Class Description
    Function
    Class representing a function f(x) with FunctionParts

    For Example:
    Funktion.functionParts[Sin(4), PowerFunction(3,4), ExponentialFunction(2,5)]
    toString:
    "4sin(x)+ 3x4+ 2*5x

    Features: build derivative build antiderivative calculate extreme points, turning points & more calculate function value calculate zeros (see Function.newtonMethod(Interval, double, Function)) calculate rotation volume calculate surface under the curve calculate mean calculate arc length
    All costy methods do have an Thread.interrupt() check implemented
    This check stops the operation and sets the interrupt flag again.
    Interval
    Class representing an interval
    Point
    Class representing a point with two dimensions
  • Classes in functions used by functions 
    Class Description
    Cos
    This class represents a cosine function with the form f(x) = a*cos(x)
    EulerExponentialFunction
    Class representing an exponential function with the e as base
    f(x) = a* e^x
    ExponentialFunction
    Class representing a exponential function with the following form:
    f(x) = a*bx
    Function
    Class representing a function f(x) with FunctionParts

    For Example:
    Funktion.functionParts[Sin(4), PowerFunction(3,4), ExponentialFunction(2,5)]
    toString:
    "4sin(x)+ 3x4+ 2*5x

    Features: build derivative build antiderivative calculate extreme points, turning points & more calculate function value calculate zeros (see Function.newtonMethod(Interval, double, Function)) calculate rotation volume calculate surface under the curve calculate mean calculate arc length
    All costy methods do have an Thread.interrupt() check implemented
    This check stops the operation and sets the interrupt flag again.
    FunctionPart
    This class is the superclass of all functionParts, which can be stored in Function.
    Interval
    Class representing an interval
    Nexus
    FunctionPart containing multiple other functionParts.
    Point
    Class representing a point with two dimensions
    PowerFunction
    Klasse, welche eine Potenzfunktion der Form f(x) = a*xp repräsentiert.
    Sin
    Class representing a sinus function
    f(x) = a * sin(x)
  • Classes in functions used by stringConverter 
    Class Description
    Function
    Class representing a function f(x) with FunctionParts

    For Example:
    Funktion.functionParts[Sin(4), PowerFunction(3,4), ExponentialFunction(2,5)]
    toString:
    "4sin(x)+ 3x4+ 2*5x

    Features: build derivative build antiderivative calculate extreme points, turning points & more calculate function value calculate zeros (see Function.newtonMethod(Interval, double, Function)) calculate rotation volume calculate surface under the curve calculate mean calculate arc length
    All costy methods do have an Thread.interrupt() check implemented
    This check stops the operation and sets the interrupt flag again.
    FunctionPart
    This class is the superclass of all functionParts, which can be stored in Function.
